# GitHub Copilot Instructions for GSE Vote

## Project Overview
GSE Vote is a voting application project. This file provides guidance to GitHub Copilot when assisting with code in this repository.

## Project Structure
This is a new project. As the codebase grows, maintain a clear and organized structure:
- Keep related functionality grouped together
- Use descriptive file and directory names
- Follow language-specific best practices for project organization

## Coding Standards

### General Principles
- Write clear, readable, and maintainable code
- Use meaningful variable and function names
- Add comments for complex logic, but prefer self-documenting code
- Follow DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself) principles
- Handle errors gracefully and provide useful error messages

### Code Style
- Maintain consistency with existing code in the repository
- Follow language-specific style guides (e.g., PEP 8 for Python, Airbnb/Google style guides for JavaScript)
- Use consistent indentation (prefer spaces over tabs)
- Keep functions focused and concise

## Testing
- Write tests for new features and bug fixes
- Ensure tests are clear and well-documented
- Aim for meaningful test coverage
- Run tests before committing changes

## Git Practices
- Write clear, descriptive commit messages
- Keep commits focused on a single logical change
- Reference issue numbers in commits when applicable

## Documentation
- Update README.md when adding new features or changing setup instructions
- Document public APIs and complex functionality
- Keep documentation up-to-date with code changes

## Security
- Never commit sensitive information (API keys, passwords, secrets)
- Validate and sanitize user inputs
- Follow security best practices for the technology stack
- Keep dependencies up-to-date

## Collaboration
- Be respectful and constructive in code reviews
- Ask questions when requirements are unclear
- Share knowledge and help team members grow
